Revealing the secret to radiant skin ‚ú®

We often get asked: Why apply Jojoba before moisturiser when it is recommended to apply oils after moisturiser? ü§î

üí° The answer? Jojoba is unlike any other oil.

Oils are usually applied AFTER moisturiser to seal in moisture and act as a protective barrier. But, rather than sitting on top of the skin like most oils do, Jojoba travels deeper down into the skin's layers. This is because it mimics the structure of the oils in our skin. 

To ensure our skin reaps the full benefits of our Jojoba and facial oils, applying them first ensures they are absorbed first and will therefore be more effective!

Why is it important to use Vitamin C in the morning? ‚òÄÔ∏è Here's our answer üëáüèª

Although you can certainly use the Vitamin C Glow Potion at night, it is incredibly effective as a daytime face oil. 

The high antioxidant content will help fight free radicals (which contribute to ageing) from UV rays and pollution as you go about your day. 

Additionally, Vitamin C can help boost the effectiveness of your sunscreen. Sunscreen acts as the first line of defence, while Vitamin C neutralises any free radicals that sneak past the sunscreen, minimising their harmful effects.

Although it is referred to as an oil, Jojoba is a wax ester üå±‚ú®

Our sebum is made up of three parts: wax esters, triglycerides and squalene. 

While you can find multiple plant sources of triglycerides and squalene, Jojoba is the ONLY known plant source of wax esters, so it's the only product you need for replenishing the wax esters in your skin! 

It's 100% pure and healthy for your skin, giving you the vital nutrients and antioxidants you need to glow üíõ

What is blue light damage? üíªüì∫üì±

Blue light is everywhere, with the sun being the biggest source. However, electronic devices like phones, laptops, and TVs also emit significant amounts. 

Some research suggests exposing your skin to blue light may contribute to premature ageing. This includes increased fine lines, wrinkles, uneven skin tone and hyperpigmentation.

Ectoin, an ingredient in our Illuminating Tinted Moisturiser with SPF15, helps shield against blue light damage by reducing free radicals, stabilising cell membranes, and keeping skin hydrated.

It can also be used to dampen the skin before serums, providing the perfect environment for your water-based serums to be absorbed.

What does 'incidental sun exposure' mean?

Our NEW Illuminating Tinted Moisturiser features SPF15, which shields the skin from incidental sun exposure to UVA/UVB rays. 

Incidental sun exposure refers to the ultraviolet (UV) radiation you get from the sun throughout the day, often without even realising it. It's the sun you encounter during everyday activities. Here are some examples:

‚òÄÔ∏è Walking to work or running errands
‚òÄÔ∏è Waiting at a bus stop
‚òÄÔ∏è Driving in a car
‚òÄÔ∏è Sitting by a window at home or work

Even if you don't get much exposure to the sun, you can feel good knowing the Illuminating Tinted Moisturiser SPF15 is taking care of your skin.

So what is Ectoin and why is it great for your skin?

Ectoin is a superhero for stressed-out skin! It's a natural ingredient found in extremophiles (organisms that thrive in harsh environments) that acts like a shield. 

ü§ç Reduces redness and irritation: 
Ectoin calms and soothes the skin, making it ideal for sensitive complexions.

ü§ç Boosts hydration: 
It helps your skin retain moisture, keeping it plump and healthy.

ü§ç Protects from environmental damage: 
Ectoin acts as a barrier against aggressors like pollution and blue light from electronics, which can damage your skin over time.
